abstract: The Loblaw Companies, Canada’s largest grocery chain and once one of North America’s most innovative retailers, is struggling with inventory problems and its first annual loss in 19 years.
snippet: The Loblaw Companies, Canada’s largest grocery chain and once one of North America’s most innovative retailers, is struggling with inventory problems and its first annual loss in 19 years.
lead_paragraph: OTTAWA, April 9 — When Queen Elizabeth needs groceries, her staff usually sends out to Fortnum & Mason. Household goods at Buckingham Palace often come from the Selfridges department store. And the tea poured at royal tea parties is likely to have been blended by R. Twining & Company.

headline.main: Purveyor to the Queen Faces Test From Wal-Mart
headline.print_headline: Back to Roots For Retailer In Canada
